meanings.definition: The upper side or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The bird landed on the topside of the branch.
meanings.sent2: The cat climbed to the topside of the wall.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot on the topside of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The clouds floated lazily in the sky's topside.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone brightly on the topside of the mountain.

meanings.definition: The highest point or part of something.
meanings.sent1: The mountaineer reached the topside of the peak.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered at the topside of the pole.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a cherry on its topside.
meanings.sent4: The topside of the tower offered a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The topside of the hill was covered in wildflowers.

meanings.definition: To place something on the upper side or surface of something else.
meanings.sent1: She carefully topsided the plate with whipped cream.
meanings.sent2: He topsided the sandwich with a slice of cheese.
meanings.sent3: The chef topsided the pizza with fresh basil leaves.
meanings.sent4: They topsided the cake with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent5: The artist topsided the canvas with a layer of varnish.
